comments:
This morning, i started eclipse and after the Eclipse workbench was refreshed, 
my current open (Java) project had dozens of warnings! I never have any 
warnings because i try to avoid/eliminate them as soon as Eclipse tells me. I 
also have configured the options for the Compiler (Preferences > Java > 
Compiler) to show warnings just for some problems.

The strange thing is that no all of the warnings displayed in the Package 
explorer also show up in the corresponding Java editors. And none shows up in 
the Task view (no filter on warnings).

Because for these reasons and it just suddenly happens without doing anything 
than starting Eclipse, i looked into the .log file and noticed these entries:


-----------------------------------------

I also tried to quit and restart Eclipse but with no success.
My config: Eclipse Version 2.1.3, Build id: 200403101828 (latest official 
release through feature update).

How can i "repair" this?

Well, i found the problem: it was the Eclipse Plug-in "FindBugs" 
(http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/). However, i change the subject of this entry 
to the exception entries in the log (see below).
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 43386 ***
